text: [Music]
greetings my name is Matt Wood and I'm
here at AWS headquarters in Seattle to
give you an update on elasticache
elasticache for reddis is a fully
managed inmemory data structure service
that can be used as a data store or
cache and we have two new announcements
today firstly we're adding sharding
support with redis cluster you're no
longer limited to a single reddish Shard
instead your reddish keyspace can span
across 15 shards allowing better
availability with up to 4X reduction in
failover Times Higher throughput with
millions of iops and scaling workloads
up to 3 and A2 terabytes in size
secondly we added geospatial support
through redis 3 you can index process
search and analyze location-based data
at inmemory speeds it's easy to get
started with our improved console
interface and all of these new features
are available in cloud formation for all
of our customers today thanks a lot
